children.raw: Collabs & Battles (NEW)
children.html: Collabs & Battles (NEW)

children.raw: Collabs and Battles are handled thru a Request System!
children.html: Collabs and Battles are handled thru a Request System!

children.raw: Requests are sent once a user first submits their beep when they mark the toggle button as either ‘Collab’ or ‘Battle’ and then select a participant from the drop down.
children.html: Requests are sent once a user first submits their beep when they mark the toggle button as either ‘Collab’ or ‘Battle’ and then select a participant from the drop down.

children.raw: The usual means of accept a request is from the receiver of the request clicking accept on the notification present at the top of that round’s page!

children.raw: Overview
children.html: Overview

children.raw: This tournament is 8-rounds and is split into 2 phases (4 rounds each). The first phase operating normally and the 2nd phase being elimination based. Each round lasts one week for submissions, one week for voting. Collabs & Battles make their return in this tournament with their own special tweaks leveraging the automation of the website!
children.html: This tournament is 8-rounds and is split into 2 phases (4 rounds each). The first phase operating normally and the 2nd phase being elimination based. Each round lasts one week for submissions, one week for voting. Collabs & Battles make their return in this tournament with their own special tweaks leveraging the automation of the website!

children.raw:
Each round, there’s a prompt that contestants will make a beep based on. They’ll be rated on how well the song matches the prompt and other aspects to rank it compared to other submissions (see ‘Voting & Points’)
New features such as Prompt Modifiers- a way to spice up a round prompts for a bit of a challenge- & Bonus Tokens- a fun currency to collect that can decide the outcome of a draw in points- make their debut!
children.html: Each round, there’s a prompt that contestants will make a beep based on. They’ll be rated on how well the song matches the prompt and other aspects to rank it compared to other submissions (see ‘Voting & Points’) New features such as Prompt Modifiers- a way to spice up a round prompts for a bit of a challenge- & Bonus Tokens- a fun currency to collect that can decide the outcome of a draw in points- make their debut!

children.raw: Rounds are split into 3 of their own little states: the open period the voting period, and the finished state. Each state lasts for one week (except for the last one which is the final state of the round which reveals the results of the round)

children.raw: Phases
children.html: Phases

children.raw: The two phases of the tournament operate different and the phases change after the 4th round of the tournament, starting on round 5.
children.html: The two phases of the tournament operate different and the phases change after the 4th round of the tournament, starting on round 5.

children.raw: Each phase has it’s own point total, important for phase 1 for moving on to phase 2. This point total is comprised of the average of the top 3 rounds of the phase- allowing contestants to optionally skip a round each phase if they choose for no loss in points!

children.raw: Phase One
children.html: Phase One

children.raw: Phase One is where all contestants who applied to join can participate and submit beeps. It is a format usually seen in previous tournaments. Contestants will submit beeps, receive votes and rack up points to make it to the next phase!
children.html: Phase One is where all contestants who applied to join can participate and submit beeps. It is a format usually seen in previous tournaments. Contestants will submit beeps, receive votes and rack up points to make it to the next phase!

children.raw: Phase Two
children.html: Phase Two

children.raw: Phase 2 of the tournament is the final phase and features harsh and extreme eliminations!
children.html: Phase 2 of the tournament is the final phase and features harsh and extreme eliminations!

text.content: Phase 2 of the tournament is the final phase and features harsh and extreme eliminations!

rich_text.plain_text: Phase 2 of the tournament is the final phase and features harsh and extreme eliminations!

children.raw: At the start of Phase 2, only the top half (in points) of the contestants will move on leaving the other half of the contestants eliminated!
children.html: At the start of Phase 2, only the top half (in points) of the contestants will move on leaving the other half of the contestants eliminated!

text.content: At the start of Phase 2, only the top half (in points) of the contestants will move on leaving the other half of the contestants eliminated!

rich_text.plain_text: At the start of Phase 2, only the top half (in points) of the contestants will move on leaving the other half of the contestants eliminated!

children.raw: Each round of this phase will also group contestants into sub-brackets (based previous performance) where only the highest scoring contestant of that round moves on to the next one!
children.html: Each round of this phase will also group contestants into sub-brackets (based previous performance) where only the highest scoring contestant of that round moves on to the next one!

children.raw: Voting & Points
children.html: Voting & Points

children.raw: Points are what people earn for submitting beeps that get voted highly! It’s the primary way of ranking the contestant’s submissions compiled by fellow contestants and audience member votes.
children.html: Points are what people earn for submitting beeps that get voted highly! It’s the primary way of ranking the contestant’s submissions compiled by fellow contestants and audience member votes.

text.content: Points are what people earn for submitting beeps that get voted highly! It’s the primary way of ranking the contestant’s submissions compiled by fellow contestants and audience member votes.

children.raw: Voting Process
children.html: Voting Process

children.raw: The voting process is simple, you’ll have a Recommended Voting queue that automatically distributes the amount of voting each contestant should do, making voting go by quicker than ever
children.html: The voting process is simple, you’ll have a Recommended Voting queue that automatically distributes the amount of voting each contestant should do, making voting go by quicker than ever

text.content: The voting process is simple, you’ll have a

rich_text.plain_text: The voting process is simple, you’ll have a

text.content: queue that automatically distributes the amount of voting each contestant should do, making voting go by quicker than ever

rich_text.plain_text: queue that automatically distributes the amount of voting each contestant should do, making voting go by quicker than ever

children.raw: Live Voting is also a feature of the website, where on the last day of voting a live stream on the BeepBox Discord’s YouTube account will occur featuring the hosts playing every submission of that round! During which, you can visit the website and a “LIVE” button will be present where a mini-player of the stream and a voting prompt will open and be synced to the currently playing song of the mini-player/live-stream! An easy way to do voting for every submission and rack up those bonus tokens!
children.html: Live Voting is also a feature of the website, where on the last day of voting a live stream on the BeepBox Discord’s YouTube account will occur featuring the hosts playing every submission of that round! An easy way to do voting for every submission and rack up those bonus tokens!

children.raw: Point Calculation
children.html: Point Calculation

children.raw: Points are basically from 0 - 1000 (or 0 - 100 with an extra decimal point, lol)
children.html: Points are basically from 0 - 1000 (or 0 - 100 with an extra decimal point, lol)

text.content: (or 0 - 100 with an extra decimal point, lol)

rich_text.plain_text: (or 0 - 100 with an extra decimal point, lol)

children.raw: Votes from contestants account for 80% of the total points, while audience votes are 20%
children.html: Votes from contestants account for 80% of the total points, while audience votes are 20%

text.content: of the total points, while audience votes are

rich_text.plain_text: of the total points, while audience votes are

children.raw: The score from an individual vote is based on the 3 highest categories of the 4 total (accounting for 70% of the score) + prompt rating (accounting for 25% of the score) + the lowest category of the 4 only accounting for the remaining 5% of the score!
children.html: The score from an individual vote is based on the 3 highest categories of the 4 total (accounting for 70% of the score) + prompt rating (accounting for 25% of the score) + the lowest category of the 4 only accounting for the remaining 5% of the score!

children.raw: The 4 categories are composition, production, structure, and style, which voters will rank from 0 to 10- and only the 3 highest ratings of these will contribute to the overall 70% of an individual vote’s score- with the lowest category only contributing 5% since some beeps (and songs in general) only strive for certain categories but not others, cushioning the blow in those cases!
children.html: The 4 categories are composition, production, structure, and style, which voters will rank from 0 to 10- and only the 3 highest ratings of these will contribute to the overall 70% of an individual vote’s score- with the lowest category only contributing 5% since some beeps (and songs in general) only strive for certain categories but not others, cushioning the blow in those cases!

children.raw: And finally, only the highest 70% of contestant votes will count towards it’s 80% contribution to the total- as well as the highest 70% of audience votes counting towards it’s 20% contribution to the final score of a submission!
children.html: And finally, only the highest 70% of contestant votes will count towards it’s 80% contribution to the total- as well as the highest 70% of audience votes counting towards it’s 20% contribution to the final score of a submission!

children.raw: This is mainly to prevent anyone who just votes bad on purpose from affecting the final score- but also just cushioning those votes a little

children.raw: C_{atA} = {1st\ Highest\ Category}\\C_{atB} = {2nd\ Highest\ Category}\\C_{atC} = {3rd\ Highest\ Category}\\C_{atD} = {Lowest\ Category}

children.raw: H_{CV} = {Top\ 70\%\ of\ Contestant\ ALL\ Votes}\\H_{AV} = {Top\ 70\%\ of\ Audience\ ALL\ Votes}\\C_{ollab} = {1\%\ if\ submission\ is\ a\ collab;\ 0\%\ if\ not}
children.html: H_{CV} = {Top\ 70\%\ of\ Contestant\ ALL\ Votes}\\H_{AV} = {Top\ 70\%\ of\ Audience\ ALL\ Votes}\\C_{ollab} = {1\%\ if\ submission\ is\ a\ collab;\ 0\%\ if\ not}

equation.expression: H_{CV} = {Top\ 70\%\ of\ Contestant\ ALL\ Votes}\\H_{AV} = {Top\ 70\%\ of\ Audience\ ALL\ Votes}\\C_{ollab} = {1\%\ if\ submission\ is\ a\ collab;\ 0\%\ if\ not}

rich_text.plain_text: H_{CV} = {Top\ 70\%\ of\ Contestant\ ALL\ Votes}\\H_{AV} = {Top\ 70\%\ of\ Audience\ ALL\ Votes}\\C_{ollab} = {1\%\ if\ submission\ is\ a\ collab;\ 0\%\ if\ not}

children.raw: S_{core} = round(((avg(H_{CV}) *80\%) + (avg(H_{AV}) *20\%)) * 1000) - C_{ollab}
children.html: S_{core} = round(((avg(H_{CV}) *80\%) + (avg(H_{AV}) *20\%)) * 1000) - C_{ollab}

children.raw: Prompt Modifiers
children.html: Prompt Modifiers

children.raw: Prompt Modifiers are contestant submitted words that are either a noun, adjective, or verb that can be added to a round’s prompt to modify it’s meaning/interpretation to the contestant making the beep as well as the people listening and leaving a vote.
children.html: Prompt Modifiers are contestant submitted words that are either a noun, adjective, or verb that can be added to a round’s prompt to modify it’s meaning/interpretation to the contestant making the beep as well as the people listening and leaving a vote.

children.raw: Bonus Tokens
children.html: Bonus Tokens

children.raw: Bonus Tokens are an extra pool of points earned by completing special challenges throughout the event. Bonus Tokens are fun to try to collect! They have no effect on the actual score of your submissions, but there will be a leaderboard showing off the participants that go the extra mile to earn them. In the rare case of a tie in any situation, the participant with the most Bonus Tokens will be declared the winner!
children.html: Bonus Tokens are an extra pool of points earned by completing special challenges throughout the event. Bonus Tokens are fun to try to collect! They have no effect on the actual score of your submissions, but there will be a leaderboard showing off the participants that go the extra mile to earn them. In the rare case of a tie in any situation, the participant with the most Bonus Tokens will be declared the winner!

children.raw: The judging contribution is also exponential using an ease in out circular function, meaning that higher scores above 50% will lean higher towards 100% and lower scores below 50% will lean lower towards 0%- but not always (e.i. 95% will equal 100% and 10% will equal 0% after this easing function is applied)

children.raw: Collabs
children.html: Collabs

children.raw: Collabs return again for this tournament functioning mostly the same! In this tournament collabs are handled by the website. When someone submits a song and adds someone as a collaborator, it sends that user a collaboration request on their end! Once it’s accepted the submission will list them both as authors and points will be shared between the both of them

children.raw: Battles
children.html: Battles

children.raw: Battles are another mechanic that makes it return to this tournament, also mostly functioning the same! In this tournament battles are handled by the website. When someone submits a song and adds someone as a challenger, it sends that user a battle request on their end! Once it’s accepted the submission will list them both as challengers and tokens will be affected accordingly…
